newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka rupee closes up on profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka rupee closes up on profit-taking.

text.p: The Sri Lanka rupee came off the day's low and closed up on profit-taking, dealers said.
The rupee closed at 58.27 to the dollar after opening at 58.33 and falling to 58.40, they said.

"Imports covering and speculation pushed the rupee down to 58.40 at which level sellers entered the market," said a Sampath Bank dealer. Overnight call money rates closed at seven percent after opening at eight, with the market well offered, dealers said.
The rupee is expected to see see-saw trade ahead of Sinhala and Tamil New year in mid-April as buyers cover imports and building positions and sellers take profit, dealers said.
